alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 11:05AM CDT until June 08 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma, southeast Oklahoma and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc and Seminole. In southeast Oklahoma, Atoka, Coal and Hughes. In southern Oklahoma, Garvin. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1105 AM CDT, Heavy rain due to thunderstorms have already occured. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ada, Coalgate, Stratford, Byng, Stonewall, Stringtown, Lehigh, Tupelo, Fitzhugh, Centrahoma, Fittstown, Wardville, Vanoss, Daisy, Phillips, Jesse, Atoka Reservoir, Chockie, Redden and northern McGee Creek Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
